newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan April index of leading indicators slides.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan April index of leading indicators slides.

text.p: Taiwan's index of leading business indicators, which forecasts peaks and troughs in the business cycle, slid in April from March, Taiwan's top economic planning agency said on Tuesday.
The index declined 1.3 percent to 103.2 in April from March, the first downturn after seven months of rise, the cabinet's Council for Economic Planning and Development said in a statement.
The index of coincident indicators also dropped, down 2.0 percent to 101.7 from March.
The council said the economy remained in a "green light" condition indicating a possible recovery, unchanged from March.
"The sixth consecutive green light shows domestic economy maintains a steady growth," the statement said.

Fifteen percent of a sample poll of manufacturing executives said the economy would turn worse, up from 12 percent in March, while 18 percent said the economy would improve, down from 24 percent a month earlier.
The rest said the economy would remain unchanged.
Analysts generally concur that Taiwan's economy is enjoying a modest recovery, spurred by improving export orders and healthy domestic consumption.
